ratings.comment: She probably knows her stuff, but her lecture assumes you already understand most of the content before the class. Wouldn't pass without reading the textbook over and over again. Exams are reasonably hard, but gives unreasonably limited amount of time for solving them! It assumes that you don't need to think before writing hard proofs.

She always begins a class with what she taught last class and gives a lot of examples, so it's easy to catch up in the class. Her homework is not too hard but interesting, so it's worth to spend time on it. Even though I'm not a big fan of algebra even after taking this class, I think she did a good job on teaching and recommend to take her class!

She is awesome!!! As a geometer, she uses graphs to help us understand everything! The course is challenging and the people in this class are all very smart so prepare for some long nights. But, if you love math, the experience is awesome. Overall, She is funny, caring, enthusiastic and a great teacher.

I love Tullia. The 375/376 sequence is one of the most difficult things I have ever done, but it is completely worth it. Tullia is so enthusiastic and willing to help, and her jokes are terrible. I admire and respect her and hope to be just like her someday.

Loved the 375/376 honors sequence. First semester was much harder for me, but with a much smaller class in 376, Prof Dymarz knows all of us personally and works hard to make us understand while also introducing us to cool outside math concepts along the way. Taking this sequence was an awesome challenge and learning experience.

Math 375 is an very hard class. It is proof-based math. Tullia is one of the best people who could be teaching it. She is incredibly helpful during office hours, and is one of my favorite professors ever. The material is very theoretical because that is what the class is. If you want a lot of examples take something else; here you'll get proofs.

Tullia is a dynamic lecturer. She obviously loves math and it is great to see. Unfortunately the classes she teaches are very difficult, but if you go to her office hours she will definitely help you out. I stayed there for an extra hour once.

Never take her, horrible at teaching, does not make us apply concepts, she will teach us abstract material with no applications and the whole class is like what just happened, as a person she is really nice, she might be a great mathematician but definitely not a great teacher.

Really hard course. More theoretical than I imagined but all the material will serve me very well later so it's definitely worth while. If you go to all the lectures and sections and office hours and take the time to do the homework well it is a manageable class.

Really hard course. More theoretical than I imagined but all the material will serve me very well later so it's definitely worth while. Prof. Dymarz is very passionate about the subject and if you go to all the lectures and sections and office hours and take the time to do the homework well it is a manageable class.

Contrary to rumors, this class was exceptionally well-taught. Professor Dymarz helped de-condense the dense matter called the textbook, and if the lectures were confusing, we could always refer there (two sources). Furthermore, she cares enormously about student success and is always ready to clarify after class. Grading criteria are clear.

Her lectures are literally word by word straight from the book, and she tries to rush through too many topics without caring if her students understand her or not. I wish I would've taken regular linear algebra instead.

The tests were a lot like the practice exams and her tests from previous years. This makes it easy to learn and review the material before the exams. She sometimes explained things in a difficult way but overall was a good prof.

Tullia is great! I had her last semester and she was by far my favorite professor. Her lectures get a little long, but they are a blast. She is hilarious and adorable and makes a boring class like math 171 really fun and not burdening.
She is very unique to say the least. Make sure to study her practice tests and tests from previous classes because the test questions will be very similar.

Her practice tests are very similar to her real tests. She sometimes uses questions from previous tests, so definitely look at the previous year's test on the online math library. She is VERY helpful during office hours. Overall a good professor- I would take her, as she is apparently one of the better math professors for 171.

She is too smart for this class. She tries to dumb things down, but dumbs it down too much.  When doing so, you block her out during lectures and it is harder to grasp concepts and leaves you more confused. A lot of the material you may have learned in high school, but you gotta learn it as if you have never seen the material before.
All tests are pretty clear-cut. She uses the format of the practice exams, so look at those. Also, look at tests from the year before because she tends to repeat questions.
The sample exams are similar to the exams. She explained the concepts well but not the practicality of those formulas. Homework's every week given were long.

Tullia is energetic & has good intentions, but her lectures are long and disorganized. I didn't use my lecture notes at all when doing homework or studying for tests, so you could most likely pass this class without going to lecture once. She is extremely inaccessible and unwilling to meet with students, often directing them to other teachers.

Tullia is not a professor that I would suggest to a friend. She is very unclear about what her ideas are and explains things terribly. She doesn't teach you what your homework is based on. Your TA will be the one to teach you. She is very unorganized in lectures and doesn't provide assistance during office hours. She strikes me as ditsy. TULLIABAD

Tullia often taught very easy concepts in class and then the homework was near impossible. Most of the lectures were spent having Tullia prove simple concepts. Tullia has never once helped me out with a question and most of my help came from my TA. The tests are way harder than the quizzes and homework.
On the first day of class Tullia told us not to contact her. So her availability is terrible. The tests are nothing like what is done in class or on the homework.

Professor Dymarz is really spunk and entertaining, but I was really disappointed at how unwilling she is to help students. It seems like she puts a lot of the work into the TA's hands. Really easy class besides that.

Tullia is something else. She's a unique individual but I don't know about her quality as a teacher. She knows her stuff, but a little too well. That seems to be a problem with math teachers when they don't know how to simplify things. She was gone a lot too, missed more class than I did.

All the homework is posted online. Tullia's lectures are very confusing and hard to follow. She's not good at explaining concepts and her notes on the board are extremely unorganized. There is weekly math homework that's not too hard, but the homework is nothing like the tests. Her tests are hard, but she gives out practice exams that are similar.
She's absolutely adorable and very quierky, but she's not accessible. She will often send you to your TA if you need help.

This class is a lot of concepts learned in high school pre-calc and calc. Tullia explains things in the least clear manner. Disorganized. Rude when you ask for help. The examples in class and the homework problems are not useful when preparing for exams. Her sample exams are pretty helpful though.
Exams are very fair, not overly tough. Too much busy work, too much focus on problems rather than understanding concepts.

Not too hard of a class but I suggest taking the 114 and 221 sequence instead of 171 in general.  Tulia is not a bad professor but she often times spends too much time talking about the same thing. Don't buy the text book she puts it all online.

You can tell that she understands the math but its in a way that only her mind can comprehend. It takes a lot of extra work for me to be able to understand the material and the exams seemed much harder than the material covered in lecture, discussion, and on the homework.
She's very cute.

Tullia's great! She explains math in ways students can comprehend. Many people don't like that she actually shows where the math comes from (proofs), but it's not material you get tested on. Her homework is "do-able" and her practice exams are very similar to the actual ones. She's very entertaining and its sometimes more fun just to listen to her.

I dreaded these lectures for not only were they unclear but very unhelpful. I never saw how her lectures pertained to the homework, i literally could have skipped every lecture and been fine as long as I still went to discussion (which I highly recommend.) On the plus side her practice exams are similar to the real ones and she's very quirky.

She is crazy and treats you like you're in 3rd grade. I thought I'd do okay in this class having already taken AP Calculus but no, she tells you to forget EVERYTHING you learned in high school. She lectures right up to the bell. If there is 2 minutes left in class, she'll start a whole new concept. Rely on your TA's to actually learn the material.

Very helpful and goes through examples thoroughly.  A bit disorganized at times, but overall a good professor.  Didn't bother going to every lecture, and since the materials are all online, I didn't buy the course book or the textbook.
Tullia is great! She's very friendly and helpful. Her practice exams are nearly identical to the actual exams. She's engaging and made freshman year calc much easier than expected.
Love Tullia! She explains everything well, and exams are exactly like the practice one she gives out.

Tullia was funny and quirky and kept the class engaged. She was clear and thorough with her lectures. She was also pretty organized and taught so everyone could understand. Her tests and homework were fair and her practice tests were helpful. I recommend taking her!
I definitely recommend her. Her exams are very fair. I don't regret taking the class with her. She is quirky.

Great professor. Some people didn't like that she taught you how to actually do the math and where it comes from instead of just plugging and chugging, but I found it helpful. If you want an A you may have to go into office hours, but overall the class is good.
I learned a lot from this class. She goes through every topic so everyone can understand it. I recommend her for Math 171.
Very clear with what she is teaching. Lectures aren't boring. A lot of proofs but worth it. Very fair exams.
Very clear and passionate about math.  Not very helpful on tests.  TA sections are a waste of time but account for 20% of grade.

She likes to write a lot on the board but she makes everything very clear and goes through everything in depth. She will always make sure things are understood before moving on. The exams are exactly like the practice ones but with different numbers! Highly recommend...great professor!! However, homework problems are tricky

Tullia was very nice and a good teacher! Lecture is incredibly boring and contains a lot of proofs. Her exams are just like the practice exams, so as long as you can do those, than it is an easy A. Overall good teacher and approachable/friendly.

Tullia was great professor for this class. She tried class entertained with jokes, which pretty "nerdy" but still hilarious. She covered all the topics and was very easy to understand. Her practice exams resembled the midterms closely. Not an obsessive amount of homework. Only thing I have left is the final, I'm confident she'll leave us prepared.

I Loved Tullia, she did a great job covering all of the material and doing examples for each type of problem. Her practice exams were very much like the actual exams and they were graded fairly. I would recommend her to anyone I know

She was so painfully boring that I stopped going to class and still did fine. You're almost better off learning from the book by yourself. But note that the tests are hardly ever like her practice tests.

340 was an easy class and Tullia was an okay professor. She had a good attitude and gave good lectures, but outside of class she was arrogant and unhelpful. I'd take 340 instead of 341 any day, however

Class is so boring. She rambles as if everyone knows the info already. Lecture is unorganized, and makes many mistakes while giving notes. Homework was difficult but exams were easy since she took exact proofs from the book and class and put them on the exam
You can tell that she is new.  The homework is annoying and the grading is awful on them. Exams are straightforward however. I'd recommend for an easy class like Linear Algebra.

Her lectures are good, but she's probably the worst professor I've ever had in terms of helpfulness outside of class. And she's not at all supportive of her students--shes seems more concerned with whatever is going on with her, rather than the class.
